philosophers.name: Socrates
phrases: I only know that I know nothing.
An unexamined life is not worth living.
Know thyself.
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.

philosophers.name: Plato
phrases: The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do.
The measure of a man is what he does with power.
Love is a serious mental disease.
Courage is knowing what not to fear.
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

philosophers.name: Aristotle
phrases: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
Excellence is an art won by training and habituation.
Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

philosophers.name: Immanuel
phrases: Enlightenment is man's emergence from his self-imposed immaturity.
Act in such a way that you treat humanity, whether in your own person or in the person of any other, never merely as a means to an end but always at the same time as an end.
Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
Two things awe me most, the starry sky above me and the moral law within me.
We are not rich by what we possess but by what we can do without.

philosophers.name: Rene
phrases: I think, therefore I am.
It is not enough to possess a good mind; the most important thing is to apply it correctly.
Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.
Cogito, ergo sum. (I think, therefore I am.)
Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it.

philosophers.name: Friedrich
phrases: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
God is dead.
The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe.
He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
Without music, life would be a mistake.

philosophers.name: Jean Paul
phrases: Existence precedes essence.
We are condemned to be free.
Hell is other people.
Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.
Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.

philosophers.name: John
phrases: All mankind... being all equal and independent, no one ought to harm another in his life, health, liberty or possessions.
The only defense against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not already common.
The only way to comprehend what mathematicians mean by Infinity is to contemplate the extent of human stupidity.
To love truth for truth's sake is the principal part of human perfection in this world, and the seed-plot of all other virtues.

philosophers.name: David
phrases: Reason is, and ought only to be the slave of the passions.
The life of man is of no greater importance to the universe than that of an oyster.
Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous; those in philosophy only ridiculous.
Beauty is no quality in things themselves: It exists merely in the mind which contemplates them.
The corruption of the best things gives rise to the worst.

philosophers.name: Karl
phrases: The history of all previous societies has been the history of class struggles.
Religion is the sigh of the oppressed creature, the heart of a heartless world, and the soul of soulless conditions. It is the opium of the people.
The philosophers have only interpreted the world in various ways; the point is to change it.
The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them.
The human being is in the most literal sense a political animal, not merely a gregarious animal, but an animal which can individuate itself only in the midst of society.
